ai-ud8.2:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud8.2:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.
ai-ud8.2:1.4_0: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
ai-ud8.2:2.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.2:3.1_0: “It’s hard to see what they call the ‘uninclined’,
ai-ud8.2:3.2_0: for the truth is not easy to see.
ai-ud8.2:3.4_0: who knows and sees, there is nothing.”
